home.stateVisualizers.factories
Class StateVisualizerFactory

java.lang.Object
  home.stateVisualizers.factories.StateVisualizerFactory

public class StateVisualizerFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This class hands you a factory which can create state visualizers for items. Although there is no obligation to use this class to create state visualizers, this should be the preferred way because this factory takes care of style integrity and other comforts. This concrete implementation returns StateVisualizerObservers of the Std-package, but you are free to write own StateVisualizerFactories

Version:
20120512
Author:
langenhagen

createStateVisualizer

public StateVisualizer createStateVisualizer(Item item,
                                             DeviceType type)
Creates a state visualizer of the specified type for the given item and attaches it automatically to the item.
Override this method when subclassing the factory.

Parameters:
item - The Item to which the state visualizer shall correspond
type - The DeviceType of the command to create
Returns:
Returns the new DeviceCommand

createStateVisualizer

public final StateVisualizer createStateVisualizer(Item item,
                                                   DeviceType type,
                                                   boolean attachToItem)
Creates a state visualizer of the specified type for the given item and may attaches it automatically to the item.

Parameters:
item - The Item to which the state visualizer shall correspond
type - The DeviceType of the command to create. If the given DeviceType is not recognized by this method, an DummyVisualizer will be used.
attachToItem - Specifies, if the new StateVisualizer shall be attached to the specified Item automatically. If set to TRUE, this method automatically calls Item.setStateVisualizer() On the given Item.
Returns:
Returns a new StateVisualizer.
